nodes.label: Watched Terminator 2: Judgment Day
nodes.description: Watched the summer blockbuster in theaters as a kid, became inspired by special effects and later on know the work of the legendary Stan Winston.

nodes.label: Maximum Carnage
nodes.description: Bought the comic where Carnage first appears in Spider-Man; making me passionate about drawing comics.

nodes.label: Thought Visual Basic was a Design Tool
Quake and computing
nodes.description: The game that got me into computing. This was the moment I realized cheat codes were just debug tools in the console; also discovered the Music of Nine Inch Nails.

nodes.label: Metal Gear Solid on Playstation
nodes.description: Discovered the cinematic storytelling through the media of video games by Hideo Kojima.

nodes.label: Studied Art History in high school
nodes.description: Studied Art History in a running start program and was introduced to, "The Conversion of St. Paul" by Caravaggio. This propeled me to learn art history and major in Studio Art when I went to college.

nodes.label: Studied Art
nodes.description: Graduated with a BFA in Drawing and Painting, with interdisciplinary studies in Computer Science, Art History, and the Humanities. Took a gap year to prepare for an MFA, but never went—instead designing app interfaces for a new device called the iPhone.

nodes.label: Created MySpace page
nodes.description: Created a MySpace page and ushered in my first heavily used social media site in Web 2.0. I learned the z-index property as a way to overlay a custom layout on top of the MySpace page.

nodes.label: Go to CCA for Grad School
nodes.description: A potential path that wasn't taken—exploring what might have happened if I had pursued an MFA at California College of the Arts.

nodes.label: Move to San Francisco
nodes.description: A potential path that wasn't taken—exploring what might have happened with an earlier move to the Bay Area.

nodes.label: Deployed first Ruby on Rails app on Heroku
nodes.description: Built a Rails app with my friend Adam called Twote.it. The idea is to generate different quotes that you could automatically post on multiple Twitter accounts.

nodes.label: Started Xhatch, my own company
nodes.description: Started my own company, learning firsthand what it means to build products, work with clients, and run a business. This experience shaped my understanding of entrepreneurship and the challenges of building something from scratch.

nodes.label: Continue Xhatch
nodes.description: A potential path that wasn't taken—exploring what might have happened if I had continued building and growing Xhatch instead of moving on.

nodes.label: Watched Bret Victor's 'Inventing on Principle'
nodes.description: Fell in love with creative tools after watching this inspiring talk in the worst hotel conference room ever.

nodes.label: Black Pixel
nodes.description: Joined as a designer, helping build the design foundation from the ground up. Helped scale both the design team and the company's vision for a more expressive, accessible internet. Built processes and systems that would support the company's long-term vision while shipping features that delighted users.

nodes.label: One Medical
nodes.description: Led product design during One Medical's critical transition to virtual care and eventual IPO. Designed experiences that transformed how primary care is delivered, making healthcare more accessible and human-centered. The work reinforced my belief that design can transform industries, even ones as complex and regulated as healthcare.

nodes.label: Explored iOS Developer career path
nodes.description: A potential path that wasn't taken—exploring what might have happened if I had pursued iOS development instead of product design.

nodes.label: Webflow
nodes.description: Joined as the first Head of Design, building the design foundation from the ground up. Helped scale both the design team and the company's vision for a more expressive, accessible internet. Built processes and systems that would support the company's long-term vision while shipping features that delighted users.

nodes.label: Spoke at Config
nodes.description: Gave a talk at Figma's Config conference titled 'The Universal Challenges of Every Scaling Design Team', sharing insights from experience leading design teams.

nodes.label: Made first Angel Investment
nodes.description: Made my first angel investment, beginning a journey that would lead to investing in over 30 companies by 2024. Focused on early-stage startups at the intersection of creativity, code, and community.

nodes.label: Proof of Concept Newsletter
nodes.description: Started writing Proof of Concept, a newsletter about design, technology, and entrepreneurship. Weekly publication exploring the intersection of creativity, code, and community.

nodes.label: Replit
nodes.description: Served as VP of Marketing and Design, leading the rebrand that repositioned Replit from a hobby app to a professional AI-native software development platform. Launched developer events and pushed forward new ways to ship AI-native products. The rebrand honored the history of software while embracing the future of AI.

nodes.label: Play
nodes.description: Started advising Play, contributing strategic guidance and insights to help shape the company's direction.

nodes.label: Joined Atlassian
nodes.description: Currently serving as VP and Head of Design, AI, helping shape the future of work through generative AI and systems design. Leading design for Rovo, Atlassian's AI-powered knowledge assistant that breaks down silos by connecting teams, work, and applications across the entire SaaS ecosystem.

nodes.label: Spoke at Hatch Conference
nodes.description: Keynote speaker at Hatch Conference 2024, delivering 'Design & (Blank)'—a talk exploring the evolving role of design and its intersections with technology, AI, and the future of creative work.

nodes.label: Retire in Barcelona
nodes.description: A dream for the future—retiring in Barcelona, enjoying the vibrant culture, beautiful architecture, and Mediterranean lifestyle.
